result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael D Banks

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael D Banks not in court, in custody.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Michael D Banks.  Attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Case is in resolution posture. Court accepts defendant's pending case 22CM1896 for a global resolution from Branch 15. Court adjourn matter for plea and sentencing. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 11, 2023 at 10:30 am.

ADJOURNED OFF THE RECORD.
Case calendared for a Scheduling Conference.
This court is in trial and ordered matter adjourned off the record.
Per email from Ada Murphy this case was tabbed to Branch 19 in error.
Court ordered case transferred to Branch 11 and placed on their calendar for a scheduling conference.
New date confirmed with parties via email.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael D Banks appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii appeared by video for Michael D Banks.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer B. Laufenberg. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in court, defendant Michael D Banks not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for status of counsel. Attorney Rakestraw has been appointed. Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael D Banks not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. State request a State V-LEE hearing or Status on next date. Court GRANTS status of counsel for next court date. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a STAUS of counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES: 
 Defendant Michael D Banks in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Michael D Banks in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
